title: Boundary Breaks 2013 No. 198 Single Vineyard Reserve Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: A waxy vein of petroleum cuts enticingly through juicy-sweet pink grapefruit and peach flavors in this dainty semisweet Riesling. It's vivaciously spry yet finishes long on a lingering lacy veil of sweetness. Drink now through 2022.

title: Caliza 2012 Azimuth Red (Paso Robles)
description: Loads of purple fruit and baked goods show on the nose of this 36% Mourvèdre, 34% Grenache and 30% Syrah blend, reminiscent of blueberry pie and olallieberry-vanilla muffins. Flavors are plump and ripe, like blackberry cookie dipped in caramel-milk chocolate sauce. Fans of big Paso reds, rejoice.

title: Castello di Amorosa 2012 Don Thomas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: On the western edge of the appellation, this vineyard provides a juicy, dusty core of full-bodied tannins and black cherry, a generous expression of ripe fruit with a complex edge. It finishes with touches of broth and tomato leaf.

title: Stadt Krems 2014 Ried Grillenparz Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: A faint but enticing notion of pink grapefruit plays on the nose, and there are floral nuances too. The palate is fruity and fresh and has an appealing, concentrated core of textured citrus zest, followed by a wonderfully clean finish.

title: Jurtschitsch 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Niederösterreich)
description: Wonderfully pure notes of wild bilberries perfume the nose of this translucent, slender-bodied red. Spice and fluidity, ease and honesty make this a very enjoyable red. There are edges of spice and some resolving, very fine tannins. This is wonderfully ready.

title: Jurtschitsch 2012 Rotspon Reserve Red (Niederösterreich)
description: Glimpses of red cherry on the nose become evident and juicy on the lovely, translucent palate. There is a playful interchange with peppery, spicy savor and real freshness. The tannins are subtle and soft, and do not impede any of the lively joy that in in the glass here.

title: Keuka Spring 2014 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Luscious pink grapefruit and peach undulate throughout this rich, penetrating Riesling. It's intensely concentrated yet zesty and spry in mouth feel. The finish is marked by a deliciously clingy kiss of honeysuckle and caramelized sugar. Drink now for its buoyant, fruity exuberance.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Equal parts Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine offers aromas of kiwi, spice and citrus that provide nuance and appeal. It's textured and full in feel, stretching out on the finish.
designation: Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown

title: McIntyre Vineyards 2013 Block 3 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Woody fruit notes of elderberry and bramble meet with graphite and sagebrush on the nose of this block-designated bottling from the longtime growing family. Plums and cranberries get a serious juniper and pine-sap twist on the palate, laid across lots of loamy earth. The grippy character will soften and protect this wine, so drink 2018–2025.

title: Meinklang 2014 Graupert Pinot Gris (Burgenland)
description: The nose informs subtly about slight oak and freshly cut green and yellow apples. The palate is apple-fresh and rounded with a pleasant midpalate weight. Hints of smoke and hazelnut glint happily here and there, making for a very appetizing Pinot Gris—a world apart from the popular Italian style.

title: Frank Family 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Orange and cranberry take center stage, while savory cinnamon and cardamom dance in the background, shimmering around full-bodied tannin and oak. Mildly exotic, there's an intensity to this wine, that ends in fig compote.

title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2011 Doña Bernarda Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Overt oak, tobacco and earthy cherry and plum aromas create a nice bouquet on this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend. A loamy, plump palate is just firm enough, while herbal plum and cassis flavors finish with carob, coffee and vanilla notes. Drink through 2017.

title: Lusso Della Terra 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is lean on the nose and perfumed in honeysuckle and apple blossom. With its power in balance, the fruit can shine. Lemon and Gravenstein apple exude from the entry while a medium-toned structure buoys the subtle spicy notes of the oak, never letting them overtake the finish.

title: Five Star Cellars 2012 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of dark plum and blackberry display purity and freshness. Elegant flavors show depth and finesse, with a lingering finish. It's a very pretty expression of the variety.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2014 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Sun-kissed tangerine, yellow peach and mango flavors drench the palate of this deeply concentrated Gewürztraminer. It's unabashedly forward and fruity yet briskly composed, finishing long on a deliciously astringent grapefruit note. Drink now through 2016.

title: Dumas Station 2012 Cuvee No. 439 Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this wine leads with aromas of barrel spices, graphite, cassis and black licorice. It's full flavored, with a core of blackberry and barrel-spice notes that glide on the finish.

title: Nigl 2014 Goldberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: Earth mingles with freshly cut apple peel in an appetizing fashion, while both apple and earth remain a constant on the taut palate: It is lit up with fresh acidity and shows a pleasant apple-peel texture and a clean, lasting finish.

title: Episode 2012 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This substantially structured red blend consists of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon, 39% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc. Blackberry and black currant sway between savory and juicy personalities, with a persistent echo of milk chocolate that rises on the finish. Along the way, expect black licorice and pepper. This wine can be enjoyed now or cellared through 2020.

title: Planeta 2014 Nero d'Avola Nocera Red (Sicilia)
description: A blend of 70% Nero d'Avola and 30% Nocera from the extreme tip of northeastern Sicily, this offers enticing scents of violet, red berry and Mediterranean brush. The bright, juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, chopped herb and a note of ground pepper alongside fresh acidity and round, polished tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Napa Cellars 2012 V Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a nicely made, full-bodied wine, richly layered in vanilla, cassis and cedar, a mix of savory and fruity. Dried herb, tobacco and oak provide a succulent backbone while the acidity stays firm and fresh in the glass.

title: Tasca d'Almerita 2011 Rosso del Conte Red (Contea di Sclafani)
description: Aromas of mature black-skinned berry, wild mint, dill, coffee and tobacco emerge on this full-bodied red. The round palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, chopped herb and a hint of black pepper framed in velvety tannins while a licorice note closes the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Merryvale 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This polished wine is accented with small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Juicy, spicy and leathery, it has a smoothness to the texture, the tannins well integrated and permissive of the plummy fruit. The finish has a smoky, mocha tinge.

title: H. & M. Hofer 2014 Freiberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Total fruity freshness emanates from the glass: fresh Conference pear, lemon zest and a riper notion of yellow mirabelle plum. This is utterly appetizing. The palate adds a dimension of pepper and a broader notion of yeast in the texture. This blooms with fruit and finishes on clean lemon zest and white pepper.

title: Heribert Bayer 2012 In Signo Leonis Red (Burgenland)
description: Fruit and wood combine for a seductive intro: the sonorous, soothing notes of vanilla unite ripe, aromatic blueberry fruit, floral overtones and rounded spice. This is smooth and pliant with an all-velvet core on a fullish body. Blueberry echoes long after the last sip.

title: Hiedler 2014 Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Fresh, crunchy green apples and pears are signalled on the nose. On the slender, streamlined palate they turn into more spicy notions of grapefruit, with peppery herbs like watercress, lovage and thyme. The palate remains focussed and fresh, taut and sprightly.

title: Johann Heinrich 2011 Cupido Ange de l'amour Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: The vanilla spice and smokiness of new oak dominates the nose, the palate however is subtle and smooth where dark berry fruit is edged by smoky spice. The fine tannins are still a little drying but there is an underlying juiciness that just spells joy in an elegant fashion. Ready to drink now.

title: Johann Heinrich 2012 VITIKULT Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Vanilla and notes of mocha pervade nose and palate: this peppery, ripe and cherry-laden Blaufränkisch has a good dollop of fine oak spice. The generous body counters dill fruit and mellow spice with ample freshness and ripe, pliable tannins. Lovely now but a year or two of bottle age will reveal more of the rich fruit.

title: San Martino 2012 Siir  (Aglianico del Vulture)
description: Subdued aromas of dark-skinned berry, baking spice, truffle and leather slowly emerge in the glass. The chewy, delicious palate is more expressive, delivering juicy black cherry, raspberry jam, white pepper and a mineral note while firm, refined tannins provide youthful tension. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Solminer 2013 Vollmond Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: With a rare if tiny showing for the Blaufränkisch grape (3%), which this estate grows on their Los Olives property, this is a tangy, tart and lean Syrah, with bright cherry fruit, coffee, light menthol, tobacco and cedar on the nose. Aromatic wood flavors of pipe smoke and cigar box show on the palate, along with red cherry fruit, vanilla and sagebrush elements.

title: Soos Creek 2012 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: Hailing from one of the state's most esteemed vineyards, this wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (42%), Merlot (33%) and Cabernet Franc. Jammy aromas of red and black fruit and licorice lead to plush but well-balanced flavors that linger.
